film.description: Movies available for rental in DVD format

columns.title: The title of the film as it appears on the DVD cover
columns.description: Brief plot summary of the film
columns.release_year: Year the film was released in theaters
columns.length: Runtime of the film in minutes
columns.replacement_cost: Cost to replace the DVD if damaged
columns.rating: Film rating (G, PG, PG-13, R, NC-17)
columns.special_features: Special features included on the DVD

business_rules.rental_pricing: Rental rate must be less than replacement cost
business_rules.rating_restriction: NC-17 films cannot be rented to customers under 18

metrics.revenue_by_film: Total revenue generated by each film
metrics.rental_frequency: Number of times a film has been rented

customer.description: Individuals who rent DVDs from the store

columns.store_id: Store location where customer is registered
columns.active: Whether the customer account is active (1) or inactive (0)
columns.create_date: Date when the customer account was created
columns.last_update: Last time customer information was updated

business_rules.late_fee: Customers with outstanding late fees cannot rent additional films

rental.description: Records of DVDs rented by customers

columns.rental_id: Unique identifier for each rental transaction
columns.rental_date: Date and time when the DVD was rented
columns.inventory_id: Specific copy of the film that was rented
columns.return_date: Date and time when the DVD was returned (null if not yet returned)
columns.staff_id: Staff member who processed the rental
columns.last_update: Last time the rental record was updated

business_rules.return_policy: DVDs must be returned within the rental duration period
business_rules.late_fee_calculation: Late fees are calculated based on days past the due date

metrics.avg_rental_duration: Average time customers keep DVDs before returning
metrics.overdue_rentals: Number of rentals that have not been returned by the due date

payment.description: Financial transactions for rentals and late fees

columns.staff_id: Staff member who processed the payment
columns.payment_date: Date and time when the payment was made
columns.last_update: Last time the payment record was updated

business_rules.refund_policy: Refunds must be processed within 30 days of the original payment

columns.last_update: Last time the actor record was updated

staff.description: Employees who work at the DVD rental stores

columns.staff_id: Unique identifier for each staff member
columns.store_id: Store location where staff member works
columns.active: Whether the staff member is currently employed (1) or not (0)
columns.last_update: Last time the staff record was updated

business_rules.manager_assignment: Each store must have one designated manager

relationships.business_meaning: Customers rent films. Each customer can have multiple rentals over time.
Films are stocked in inventory. Multiple copies of the same film may exist at different stores.
Payments are made for rentals. Each rental may have one or more associated payments (e.g., initial payment plus late fees).
Staff members work at stores. Each store has multiple staff members.
Staff members process rental transactions. Each staff member handles many rentals.
Films feature actors. Each film has multiple actors in its cast.
Actors appear in films. Each actor may appear in multiple films.

find_films_by_category.description: Find films in a specific category
patterns: What movies do we have in the {category} category?
find_films_by_category.sample_query: SELECT f.* FROM film f JOIN film_category fc ON f.film_id = fc.film_id JOIN category c ON fc.category_id = c.category_id WHERE c.name = 'X'

customer_rental_history.sample_query: SELECT f.title, r.rental_date FROM customer c JOIN rental r ON c.customer_id = r.customer_id JOIN inventory i ON r.inventory_id = i.inventory_id JOIN film f ON i.film_id = f.film_id WHERE c.last_name = 'X'

patterns: List DVDs that are past due
Show rentals that haven't been returned on time
overdue_rentals.sample_query: SELECT c.first_name, c.last_name, f.title, r.rental_date, r.return_date FROM rental r JOIN customer c ON r.customer_id = c.customer_id JOIN inventory i ON r.inventory_id = i.inventory_id JOIN film f ON i.film_id = f.film_id WHERE r.return_date IS NULL AND r.rental_date + INTERVAL f.rental_duration DAY < CURRENT_DATE

patterns: How much revenue comes from each category?
Which film categories generate the most money?
revenue_by_category.sample_query: SELECT c.name, SUM(p.amount) as revenue FROM payment p JOIN rental r ON p.rental_id = r.rental_id JOIN inventory i ON r.inventory_id = i.inventory_id JOIN film f ON i.film_id = f.film_id JOIN film_category fc ON f.film_id = fc.film_id JOIN category c ON fc.category_id = c.category_id GROUP BY c.name ORDER BY revenue DESC
